intro: Astragalus tokatensis, commonly known as Tokat milkvetch, is a flowering plant species native to Turkey. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and compound leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. It plays a role in soil stabilization and is of interest for its potential medicinal properties. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
